alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Brown; Cherry; Loup; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 29 at 10:24PM CDT until June 29 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Cherry County in north central Nebraska... Rock County in north central Nebraska... Northern Loup County in north central Nebraska... Brown County in north central Nebraska... Northern Blaine County in north central Nebraska... * Until 1130 PM CDT. * At 1023 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Valentine National Wildlife Refuge to 10 miles northwest of Elsmere to near Purdum, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Ainsworth, Bassett, Long Pine, Newport, Johnstown, Purdum, Rose, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Elsmere, Wood Lake, Hofeld Lake, Fox Bayou, Raven, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, Twin Lakes, Willow Lake, Duff, Koshopah, Pine Glen State Wildlife Refuge and Antelope Peak. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 136 and 207. Highway 20 between mile markers 213 and 273. Highway 97 between mile markers 119 and 120. Highway 83 between mile markers 166 and 199. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
